programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Savannah is nervous about her first date with Dan, so Marti, Lewis and the rest of the Hellcats accompany her on the date. Marti tries to impress her law professor (GALE HAROLD).

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Lewis asks Marti out but she turns him down. Alice and Lewis have a sweaty workout together. Savannah and her mom (TERYL ROTHERY) fight when Dan comes to dinner.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Savannah talks the team into letting Dan direct their bid video against Alice's wishes. Marti investigates further into Julian's (GALE HAROLD) case. Vanessa is fought over.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Things get messy when the girls' volleyball team challenges the Hellcats to a flag football game. Marti pretends to be sick to attend a conference with Julian (GALE HAROLD).

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: The Hellcats plan a date auction, but things take a turn when Savannah's old boyfriend shows up and outbids Dan, and Morgan (CRAIG ANDERSON) wins a date with a horrified Marti.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: The Hellcats plan an '80s party, complete with costumes and a musical number by Vanessa. Marti has conflicted feelings about Savannah and Dan spending the night together.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Marti is conflicted over her feelings for Dan and Lewis, and focuses on Travis' (BEN COTTON) case to keep her mind occupied. Musical guest FEFE DOBSON performs.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: After a compromising picture of Alice is sent around school, she vows revenge. Julian (GALE HAROLD) discovers Marti and Morgan (CRAIG ANDERSON) are investigating behind his back.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: After the incident in the car, Dan gives Marti an ultimatum -- to either admit she has feelings for him or their friendship is over. Marti decides to tell Savannah what happened.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: When Alice's father (guest star MARIO VAN PEEBLES) shows up at sectionals to watch her fly, she makes a drastic decision, blackmailing Savannah for her spot.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: In an effort to raise funds for sectionals, the Hellcats shoot a sexy calendar and throw a launch party with the band 3OH!3 -- and Savannah sings with them!

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: The Hellcats kidnap Marti for her initiation into the group. They flash back on how Savannah, Alice, Lewis and Vanessa became Hellcats.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Savannah and Alice throw a toga party. Marti, Vanessa and Julian (GALE HAROLD) come up with a plan that just may get Travis (BEN COTTON) released from jail and save the Hellcats.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: A wedding forces Marti, Savannah and Dan to confront their true feelings. Vanessa and Derrick (D.B. WOODSIDE) face a tough decision. Alice visits Jake (RYAN KENNEDY) in jail.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Savannah is blown away when Charlotte (EMMA LAHANA) reveals the identity of her baby's father. Plus, the Hellcats learn they and Memphis Christian have something in common.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: AJ MICHALKA, sister to series star Aly Michalka, guest stars as a store employee who helps Marti uncover information about her father. Dan shoots a zombie film with the Hellcats.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Vanessa and Red (JEFF HEPHNER) are shocked to find that Red's ex-wife, Emily (CAMILLE SULLIVAN -- Da Vinci's Inquest), has been hired to dig up dirt on Lancer's athletics.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Savannah finds herself in trouble at school. Marti and Deidre (recurring guest star AJ MICHALKA, real-life sister of Aly Michalka) perform a guitar duet.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Lewis enters a dance contest with Kathy (MAGDA APANOWICZ) to try and win a new car for his father, but things heat up when Alice enters the competition as well. CIARA performs.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: In the season finale, an epidemic of strep throat results in the Hellcats heading to Nationals a few members short and leaving the team dangerously close to being disqualified.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In the series premiere, NYPD Detective Raimy Sullivan (PEYTON LIST) discovers she's able to speak with her deceased father, Frank (RILEY SMITH) over his old ham radio.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: When Raimy warns Frank that her mom will be murdered unless he can somehow warn her, she also delivers some devastating news about Stan Moreno (ANTHONY RUIVIVAR).

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: After Raimy uncovers evidence in the Goff case, she relays this information to Frank, prompting him to take matters into his own hands while ignoring a strong warning from Satch.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: With the date of Julie's abduction rapidly approaching, Raimy and Frank each work to gather information from a girl whose mother was taken by the Nightingale.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: When Frank helps Raimy uncover clues from the past to help solve a present day murder case, it brings up two different memories of her first day in the NYPD.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In 2016, Raimy meets a strange character named Karl (CURTIS ARMSTRONG), who speaks to himself in the future. In 1996, Frank feels like he's being taunted by The Nightingale.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: Raimy and Satch's detective work begins to pay off when a cold case victim leads them to their biggest break -- a room where the Nightingale held his first victim.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: While Raimy and Satch discover a shocking connection to the Nightingale's first kill, Frank and Julie are forced to have an honest conversation. And Raimy has a surprise visitor.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In the winter finale, Raimy and Frank make a startling discovery about the Nightingale Killer. Meanwhile, Frank is blindsided by a shocking betrayal.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: Frank & Raimy plan to kill the Nightingale, but Frank finds himself agonizing over whether it's the right thing to do. And Raimy is confronted with an unexpected moral decision.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: Raimy and Frank find themselves in the thick of things. Meanwhile, Frank learns the meaning behind a betrayal.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: Raimy and Frank make a huge discovery while continuing their search for the Nightingale killer. Meanwhile, Stan is willing to do anything to bring Frank down.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In the season finale, the truth is revealed and Raimy makes a discovery that stops her cold. She quickly reaches out to Frank on the ham radio to voice her concerns.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Ted wants to live to 100 with his beloved wife beside him. But his oral health threatens his future. Kristy‚Äôs a FIXT staffer desperate to smile big on her wedding day. Will love help them face their fears?

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find a vintage scooter delivering burritos and a seafood market with the freshest catch in town? The same place with repurposed vending machines dispensing unique art and wedding dresses made into hand-crafted heirlooms.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: In Birmingham, the guys spark joy with a pizza party, dice games, and small surprises for unhoused neighbors. A mother with MS shares her dream of racing with her family by her side, and a man facing amputation receives a life-changing wheelchair.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Master bartender Kate Gerwin visits Kansas City to talk whiskey, taste the nonalcoholic future at an innovative new bar, experience jazz at the Mutual Musicians Foundation, and learn all about Prohibition in the city that ignored it best.

programme.title: WXII 12 Presents: The Year of The Trail
programme.desc: (2023) From the coastal shores to the mountain peaks, WXII 12's Lanie Pope explores the magnificent trails that North Carolina has to offer.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: A classic mountain showdown has this hopping ski town divided. But everyone agrees that no matter which mountain reigns supreme, this four-season hot spot offers great food, bucolic retreats, and a whole new view on the great outdoors.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Culinary roots run deep, tied to family history and memories of home. This episode highlights international cuisines, as well as those that were forged here on U.S. soil.

programme.title: One Pill Can Kill
programme.desc: Told through the voices of grieving parents, this documentary follows the real and lasting impact of the fentanyl crisis. Capturing the aftermath of sudden loss, the search for answers, and the transformation of grief into public advocacy.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Kate explores gin and rituals with a master distiller, talks art and cocktails with an Indigenous painter, and gets a lesson in moving mixology on George R.R. Martin‚Äôs adventure train in the high-desert city of Santa Fe.

programme.title: Shift: The Ragbrai Documentary
programme.desc: A celebration of the oldest, largest, and longest recreational touring bicycle ride in the world. Three riders and a pair of community leaders reach new personal heights, changing their lives along the seven day ride across Iowa.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero quizzes contestants about real news stories with unreal outcomes to see if they can earn some cash. In "Oddball Olympics," locals learn about a bizarre world record, a middle school shooting star and a super swimming dog.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: In this battle, it's sink or swim. Chef Josiah of Purple Ocean Superfood Bar in Waterford Lakes takes on Chef Daniel of The Moderne in the Mills 50 district. We‚Äôve got a seafood extravaganza on this episode of Blind Kitchen.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: It's cuteness overload at a rescue farm for disabled animals and Justin's donation makes a huge difference. The guys roll out trivia bowling for Winston-Salem locals, sparking tons of laughs. Jimmy Luv kindly hides cash for lucky strangers to find.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: As flames from the deadly 2017 Tubbs Fire tore through Santa Rosa, a first-time mother went into labor, while families fled with moments to spare‚Ä¶ before making the powerful choice to return.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob tests out all types of relaxation, from sound baths to flinging an axe, discovers exciting new cuisine and quenches his thirst in this diverse and hopping Boston ‚Äòhood.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: From ice hockey to lacrosse to tennis, Baltimore coaches help drive the next generation to find family, inspiration and pride through sports.

programme.title: Searching for Johnny
programme.desc: (2022) The disappearance of Johnny Gosch is one of Iowa's longest running, and most notorious mysteries. In 1982, the 12-year-old paperboy in West Des Moines vanished without a trace. Forty years later, KCCI uncovers where the investigation stands.
